title: Facet-dependent oxysulfidation of Cu2O nanomaterials: implications for improving the efficacy of nanopesticides
content:
Environ. Sci.: Nano, 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4EN00545G, Paper
Tingting Du, Wenyu Guan, Zhanhua Zhang, Chuanjia Jiang, Pedro J. J. Alvarez, Wei Chen, Tong Zhang
Exposed facets dictate the oxysulfidation process of Cu2O nanomaterials by regulating adsorption affinities of oxygen and sulfide ions, and consequently, initial transformation products on Cu2O and subsequent dissolution of Cu2O.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
